info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 5:54PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cumberland and southern Fluvanna Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 554 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Canton, or near Fork Union, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palmyra, Fork Union, Columbia, Lakeside Village, Duncan, Dixie, Shores, Central Plains, Bremo Bluff, Cohasset, Hardware, Carysbrook and Wilmington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
